customer_reviews.title: Keeps the carsickness at bay!
customer_reviews.text: We've only used Gravol 3 or 4 times, but we've had no carsickness on those times. The ingredients say it's the same as Dramamine but my 3yo HATED the taste of the chewable dramamine and it was a battle every time. He still sometimes got sick and I never knew if it was because of when we gave it to him before driving (30 minutes vs 1 hour vs longer) or it just didn't work or whatever. He drinks this medicine happily. It doesn't make him drowsy, but we often time our long drives for a midday nap which helps for a lot of reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Cavapoo Tested and It Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm for my 10 pound Cavapoo, who can’t seem to be driven a couple of miles without throwing up. Even tried a doggie car seat in hopes that being able to see out of the window would help my dog’s carsickness - but it didn’t work at all. About an hour before we leave the house, I give my dog 1/2 teaspoon of the medicine. Gravol works great and has completely taken care of the vomiting/motion sickness problem.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R. Slicher

customer_reviews.title: Made my daughter cranky!

Unlike the other brand but in chewable form (I just delute it in water) that I give her, she seem happy even after a nap from the trip.

Thank you Gravol.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a child very much prone to car sickness. This product is expensive in comparison to chewable widely available tablets, but my 5 year old absolutely hates chewable tablets. He gets nauseous just from putting them in his mouth, so I had to go with liquid. It works ok, not 100% of the time, but it does help a lot. If your child is over 5 you probably only have 10 doses in the bottle, so you end up paying $1.50 per each dose and you need to give it every 6 hours if on a road trip, but overall I am sure we'd all agree to pay that to save your child from getting carsick.

product_meta.title: Children's Liquid GRAVOL for Nausea, Vomiting, Dizziness & Motion Sickness Ages 2+ (75ml Size)
product_meta.description: GRAVOLTM KIDS LIQUID GRAVOLTM Kids Liquid is dye and alcohol-free with a great tasting fruit flavor that is easier for children to take. Formulated for children 2-12 by Canada’s #1 Doctor and Pharmacist Recommended brand. Dosage: Children under 2 years: as directed by a physician. Children 2 to 6 years: take 1 teaspoon (5 mL) every 6 to 8 hours as needed, up to a maximum of 5 teaspoons (25 mL) in 24 hours. Children 6 to 12 years: take 2 teaspoons (10 mL) every 6 to 8 hours as needed, up to a maximum of 10 teaspoons (50 mL) in 24 hours. Take the first dose at least 1/2 hour and preferably 1 to 2 hours before departure. Indication: Prevention and treatment of nausea, vomiting and dizziness due to motion sickness. Ingredients: Active ingredient(s): Liquid / 15 mg / 5 mL dimenhydrinate Non-medicinal ingredients: Citric acid, flavour, polysorbate 80, propylene glycol, sodium benzoate, sorbitol, sucrose, water.
feature_bullets: For Nausea, Vomiting & Dizziness & Motion Sickness
